title: For Sale:   --------SCAM ALERT To EVERYONE --------
location: United States. everywhere, Little Rock, Arkansas
postcontent:
This guy searches for "want to buy" ads.  Just so happens to have exactly what you are looking for.  Says he will sell it to you at a descent price.  Just one catch...  you have to send him the money first,  then he will send you nothing.   Not a very good deal if you ask me. 

Use FFL for this. Go to a gun shop or pawn shop. They will help you with this. It's the only way.

He wants to use texts and email as primary source of contact. 
When i GOOGLED the phone number, it returns a location in HICKSVILLE NY. He told me south Carolina. 

Just be aware of these kinds of people.  True buyers and sellers will communicate via phone and want to meet in a SAFE PUBLIC PLACE.   Anything else may just be a scam and don't let your "eagerness to have it" cloud your judgment.  It probably doesn't exist anyway. 

If you feel like someone is trying to scam you, please take the time to write an ad including the phone number or anything you can about the person.  You might just help someone!

Designed with versatility in mind, slots at the two, six, and ten o'clock positions allow the attachment of optional Picatinny rail sections and other accessories for mounting tactical lights, slings, grips, etc. Reinforced, heat-resistant polymer construction provides operational durability without the weight and expense of an aluminum rail hand guard. title: For Sale:  NEW BERETTA 3032 TOMCAT 32.ACP
postcontent:
*Price shown before MN sales tax. We accept cash, money order, cashiers or personal checks, but product will be held until check clears.
*You must have a valid MN driver's license and MN Permit to Carry or Permit to Purchase.
***Dealer is open to reasonable offers.
***We price match when possible.
*2 AVAILABLE*
louisgunsales.com

Comparable in size to a smartphone, the Beretta 3032 Tomcat is tiny while offering the power of the .32 ACP cartridge. As such, this double/single-action autopistol it is perfect for deep concealment or used as a backup second handgun. Its tip-up barrel design makes it easy to load, operate and maintain, while its traditional looks give it the allure of a true classic.


Easy to Operate

The controls of the 3032 Tomcat are designed to be simple and to provide safety and peace of mind while carrying. The two-position safety engages crisply and positively, and locks the slide while also preventing the pistol from firing. The magazine release is located to the left of the grip, making it easy to locate and operate even with one hand.


Convenient Tip-Up Barrel Design

The 3032 features a tip-up barrel design typical of the classic Beretta small-frame pistols. Thanks to this design, you never need to rack the slide and you can load that first round directly into the chamber. This is especially convenient in cold weather, or for people with weaker hands. Another advantage is that the barrel may be easily cleaned without taking the pistol apart, making it convenient to give the pistol a quick wipe after a session at the range.


Easy to Conceal and Shoot  

Right from their inception, Beretta small frame pistols such as the 3032 Tomcat were designed to be carried concealed. Therefore, the lines of the Tomcat are snag-free, with the sights being engineered to easily slide in and out of a holster or belly-band without catching on anything. The rear sight is adjustable for windage, so that you can easily experiment shooting different loads while keeping your sights on target. All these features have made Beretta small frames like the 3032 a favorite for concealed carry and self-defense.

title: For Sale:  Ortgies Deutsche Werke 1921 7.65mm (32. ACP) Pistol 5th version
postcontent:
Used in Good/Very Good condition, I have shot this pistol a few times and functions perfectly. Ortgies Pocket Auto, 32ACP, 3.5" barrel, semi auto pistol.   Call me at REDACTED William
•Wood grips with brass inserts
•Brass inserts has a crouching cat that's tail forms an S
•Guns with this insert were manufactured between 1921-1924  Serial Number 67864
•Half moon front sight
•Notch rear sight
•Bluing worn off in places and turning brown from age.
•Some pitting on slide
•Hammerless
•Brand markings on right side of frame & on top of barrel  DEUTSCHE WERKE AKTIENGESELLSCHAFT - WERK ERFURT
ORTGIES’ PATENT, "Germany" stamped on bottom of barrel with the serial number.



Item History:  

The pistol was produced in 6.35 mm, 7.65 mm, and 9 mm variants. Although not expensive, at the time it was of advanced design and 

high quality construction with relatively few parts, well sealed against dirt. Metal components were forged or machined, and assembly 

in general made no use of screws, even securing the wooden grips with metal clips, although some examples do incorporate a single 

screw for that purpose. The hammerless action depended on a spring-loaded striker to fire the cartridge. As in early Colt and 

Browning pocket pistols, the Ortgies striker also operated as an ejector as the slide traveled backwards after discharge.
Unusual design features included the safety and the magazine. The safety was a lever inset into the back of the grip and, with the gun 

cocked, forced backward out of the grip into the "safe" position by spring tension from the firing pin upon depression of a button 

under the slide. Thus, engaging the safety simultaneously reduced tension on the firing pin spring. To disengage the safety, a shooter 

simply would squeeze the grip, pressing the lever forward and locking it flush with the back of the pistol.

The MK25 comes with a Short Reset Trigger (installed), Short Reach Trigger (not installed) light weight wolff hammer spring, O.D. Green hogue rubber grips, TLR-1 light, a Comp-Tac hybrid IWB holster, a galco leather holster that fits the pistol with the light attached, and all factory parts and accessories (3 mags, grips, box, and paperwork).

I am really interested in trading for a sig 556, M&P MOE Magpul AR 15,  or comparable rifle. I may also be interested in a gen 4 Glock 26 and 19 with extras or cash, newer model M&P 9 and 9c with extras or cash, or a Smith and Wesson 686 with one of the mentioned compact pistols.

I may also sell the MK25 with everything for $1200 cash, and I'm not willing to sell the pistol without the extras. I will not respond to offensive offers, so please be reasonable, and I will be extremely fair too. I don't need to sell it and would not be bothered if I end up keeping it. Thanks for looking.

This is a 2010 model with the black Duty Treatment (not the old Duty Coat) and night sights. The grips are VZ Gator Backs. I've included 2 Tripp Cobra 8-round mags in addition to the 2 original DW/Checkmate mags and 100 rounds of Speer Lawman .45 ACP 230 TMJ ammo.

title: For Sale:  New Vulcan .50 BMG sell or trade and 100 rounds ammo
postcontent:
The V50SS-300 rifle features a massive SAE 4150 receiver and a three lug bolt with a 60-degree bolt throw, cock on opening action, a shell holder type extractor for absolutely positive extraction, and a machined aircraft grade aluminum stock. The barrel is machined from ordnance grade, chrome moly, high vanadium steel hardened to Rc 28-32. The barrel is 36” long, has 8 grooves, 1-15” right hand twist and features a SAAMI spec chamber which will allow the use of any SAAMI spec ammo. The barrel and all external steel parts, are manganese phosphate finished for long lasting good looks and corrosion protection. The V50SS utilizes the time proven standard, '98 Mauser trigger system for absolute safety. This rifle also features a high efficiency "shark fin" muzzle break, machined from solid bar stock and threaded on to the muzzle of the barrel with 1-12 TPI threads. This muzzle break is designed to reduce felt recoil to that of a 12 ga. Shotgun. The muzzle break can be “Tuned” to the barrel by altering the length via the long thread shank. This feature allows the operator to find the “sweet spot” for the break that gives the best accuracy. An M1913 Picatinny scope rail is attached via oversized grade 8 allen screws for easy mounting of optics. The oversized recoil shoulder distributes the recoil over a large surface area affording rock solid mounting to the stock. The bolt has three huge locking surfaces and a 60 degree throw. It features a “primary extraction” cam for positive extraction of the case. The receiver is machined from bar stock SAE 4150 steel and features pressure release vents for BOTH case separation and primer pierce, making this one of the strongest, safest actions available. We have tested these actions and bolts to pressures exceeding 100,000 psi with no evidence of failure. The stock is machined from aircraft aluminum bar stock. This stock is made to machine tool tolerances and is completely impervious to climate and temperature. It is attached to an aluminum buttstock with a shock absorbing recoil to further reduce felt recoil and allow the shooter to comfortably shoot all day.


Specifications: Overall Length: 52" / 1321mm Barrel Length: 36” / 762mm Barrel Twist: 1-15" / 1/381mm, RH, 8 groove Weight: 30.0 Lbs / 13.6 kg Recoil: 19 ft/lbs / 2.62 kg/m / 25.7 Joules     Also have 100 rounds of .50 linked for sale or trade!  REDACTED

title: For Sale:  EVERYTHING needed to reload .223/5.56
location: West Side (near Pinardville), Manchester, New Hampshire
postcontent:
I've gotten a lot of use out of everything here, but for various reasons reloading doesn't fit my situation as well as it used to. I'm selling it all in one bulk lot, I don't want to deal with the hassle of parting it out. If you only want one component, buy the lot and sell what you don't need. It's everything needed to reload .223/5.56 - tools, components, and information (reloading books). 

The photos/organization aren't ideal, but here's the basic rundown of what's included:
* Vibratory tumbler, 5lbs of corn media, and 1 bottle of nufinish (makes for very clean, very shiny brass)
* 8lb of IMR4895 and ~1lb of Reloader15
* ~1500 .224 bullets, ranging from 55gr to 77gr - mostly Hornady, but some Sierra/Nosler match bullets
* ~5k rounds of .223/5.56 brass - some primed, some cleaned, some dirty. Some .45acp and 9mm brass is thrown in, but not much.
* Lyman and Lee reloading books
* Redding powder trickler
* Lee Turret press (auto-indexing). Comes with .223 dies, universal decapper with spare pins, and auto powder drop
* ~ 3,000 small rifle primers
* Various misc tools/supplies to support reloading operations
* Composite digital calipers
* Analog powder scale

title: For Sale:  3 Glock Factory Magazines .40 S&W model 22 or .357 Sig model 31 New 10 Shot
postcontent:
Our # XM10022

No New York City Magazine Sales. This listing is for THREE magazines, hit Buy It and you’re buying 3, not 1. Winning buyer can take any number of extras we have available at the same per-mag price and no additional shipping charges. Here are genuine factory Glock magazines to fit the Model 22 Pistol in .40 S&W Caliber, or its .357 Sig caliber peer, the Model 31. They will also fit the compact and subcompact models 23, 27, 32, and 33, only they will protrude past the magazine well on those smaller guns. Since the .40 S&W and .357 Sig caliber cartridge case heads are the same, Glock magazines for both calibers will interchange. Manufacturer is Glock gmbh of Deutsche-Wagram, Austria. Importer is Glock, Inc., of Smyrna, GA. Factory skus are MF10022 and MF10031, both are exactly the same except for caliber designation, .40 S&W or .357 Sig. Construction is classic polymer body with steel inner lining, and visible loading ports so the operator can check round count. We take these any way we can get them, whether they are individually packaged or not. Since 2012, most of the time they are shipped in bulk like the ones in the photos. Each magazine holds 10 rounds of .357 Sig or .40 S&W Caliber Ammunition, five fewer rounds than the standard issue 22015 magazines. Note the 4th Generation style release slot on the face of these magazines’ bodies. They work just fine in any Glock 22 or 31, or even those models’ compact 23 and 27 size pistols, just fine, no matter which generation the pistols are. They will protrude from the grip frame of the smaller pistols. If we are in stock on the 22015 fifteen rounders, buyers who reside in jurisdictions where those are not restricted may sub, but only if we are in stock on those. If that is what you want to do, please message us and let us check stock before you hit buy it. Replacement pricing on these in our area has recently been upwards of $50 apiece, and many times they’re hard to come by even at those prices. Our Single Magazine price is $35.00, but we usually have a separate ad on Single Magazines. We’re offering these excellent magazines, however, in lots of 3 at only $29 each. Own 3 for only $ 87.00. Not for sale to residents of New York City. Any magazine deliveries into New York City require written permission from the Police Commissioner, so we cannot ship magazines into any of the six boroughs or 176 some odd zip codes, per NYC Code 10-131.10. 

Grips, Magazines, slings, holsters, scopes, mounts, parts & most any small light items, entire accessory orders only $10.00 total shipping no matter how many a person buys. $10.00 for an entire order, Not $10.00 per item or anything of the sort. $20 Flat Fee on magazine orders to Alaska, Hawaii, or Puerto Rico, and gun parts to PR civilians must ship to an FFL. Magazines and any small light non-gun items ride free with ammo orders. We accept checks with no more than 7 days hold. GA Pay, MC, Visa, Discover phone- or fax-in 7 3 1 9 8 9 4 7 2 3 orders, USPS Money Order items shipped ASAP please put your full information, venue number, and what the item is on any messages. Internet phone hours 8:00 – 5:00 CST Mon – Fri. Robertson Trading Post 117 Front Street PO Box 365 Henderson, Tennessee 38340. We buy, sell, and trade. Always have, since 1952.

title: For Sale:  Springfield XDM 9MM
postcontent:
Contact number: REDACTED


If you’re looking for a versatile carry pistol that is packed with features, has amazing capacity, and performs flawlessly, look no farther than the XD(M)® 3.8” Compact. The XD(M)® 3.8” Compact is the smallest of the XD(M)® line, but it’s by no means the least. It boasts the same superior ergonomics, reliable performance, and features that make larger XD(M)®’s easy and intuitive to use in a slightly abbreviated package. And you’ll be amazed at how fun it is to shoot.

The XD(M)® 3.8” Compact has a 3.8 inch barrel mated with a shortened compact frame. When combined with the versatility of XD(M) Gear® X-Tension™ (USPAT7191556) magazines, the XD(M)® 3.8” Compact is ready for daily carry or a day on the range. Put in an X-Tension™ (USPAT7191556) magazine, and you have a 19 round full-sized 9mm pistol (16 rounds in .40SW, 13 rounds in .45ACP). Use the flush-fitting 13 round magazine, and you have a Compact (11 rounds in .40SW, 9 rounds in .45ACP). Like all XD(M)®’s, the XD(M)® 3.8″ Compact comes with three interchangeable backstraps, dovetail sights, mega-lock frame texturing, an ambidextrous magazine release, a multi-position frame rail, and a match grade barrel.You’ll also find all the safety features that make the XD(M)® a safe pistol in responsible hands.

If you want a gun for daily carry as well as a trip to the range, but you only want to buy one gun, try the XD(M)® 3.8” Compact. You’ll be amazed at how controllable it is to shoot and how easy it is to conceal. It’s two guns in one.
